metadata.synopsis:
This is the same character as Andorn, the bandit guard within the chapel.

This character is talking to the players through a door - he's locked the door and is on the other side, so they'll be talking TO the door and can't see him.

The player is talking to a gullible bandit through a door - the bandit is inside a chapel dungeon and his friends are outside. The player has probably either killed them or scared them away at this point. The guard is not very bright...

18.text: That you, Gimblebock? Everything all right out there?
18.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. He's reacting to them trying to open it and thinks they're his accomplice, a gnome called Gimblebock (ɡɪmbəl-bock)

3.speaker: Player
3.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. He's just found out his friends have run away; he's not particularly surprised

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Gimblebock ran. Your friends abandoned you.
20.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. He's just found out his friends have run away; he's not particularly surprised

11.text: Yeah? That lot always were a bit soft.
11.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. He's just found out his friends have run away; he's not particularly surprised

8.text: But I've got plenty of friends who ain't soft. Come in here and you can meet 'em...
8.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Just found out players scared his friends away, but he's threatening rather than scared. But he's also bluffing.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I killed your friends - now I'm here for you.
2.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Just found out his friends have been 'dealt with' by the player but feels relatively safe behind the door and is threatening. With a hint of bluffing.

6.text: Yeah? I've got plenty more friends - come in here and you can meet 'em...
6.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Just found out his friends have been 'dealt with' by the player but feels relatively safe behind the door and is threatening. With a hint of bluffing.

0.speaker: Player
0.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just claimed to be his 'boss' - a  bandit leader - and he's going to unlock the door to let them in

9.text: You sound a bit shaken, boss. Hang on while I find the key...
9.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just claimed to be his 'boss' - a  bandit leader - and he's going to unlock the door to let them in

13.text: You sound a bit shaken, boss. Hang on while I find the key...
13.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just claimed to be his 'boss' - a  bandit leader - and he's going to unlock the door to let them in

1.text: Think I'm stupid? Don't know who you are, or what you've done with the boss...
1.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. PLayer just tried to imitate his boss - a bandit leader - and he saw through the deception. He's not going to let them inside and is a little bit concerned about what's happened to his boss.

5.text: Think I'm stupid? Don't know who you are, or what you've done with the boss...
5.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. PLayer just tried to imitate his boss - a bandit leader - and he saw through the deception. He's not going to let them inside and is a little bit concerned about what's happened to his boss.

15.text: ...but if you come through that door, you're getting a knife in the guts.
15.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. he's threatening the player, who just tried to convince him they're his boss unsusccessfully. He's bluffing a little bit and is more worried than he's letting on

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Yes, it's me. Let me in!
7.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just lied to him, telling him his boss - a bandit leader - was injured in a trap. He's annoyed and a little concerned that this has happened and prepares to unlock the door

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Gimblebock triggered some trap. He needs help - now!
16.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just lied to him, telling him his boss - a bandit leader - was injured in a trap. He's annoyed and a little concerned that this has happened and prepares to unlock the door

4.text: I told him it wasn't safe out there. Get inside, and I'll rustle up some bandages...
4.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just lied to him, telling him his boss - a bandit leader - was injured in a trap. He's annoyed and a little concerned that this has happened and prepares to unlock the door

21.text: I told him it wasn't safe out there. Get inside, and I'll rustle up some bandages...
21.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just lied to him, telling him his boss - a bandit leader - was injured in a trap. He's annoyed and a little concerned that this has happened and prepares to unlock the door

17.text: Yeah? And who are you? Probably your trap that did him in...
17.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just tried to convince him his boss - a bandit leader - was injured by a trap. He's calling us out on the lie

12.text: Yeah? And who are you? Probably your trap that did him in...
12.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just tried to convince him his boss - a bandit leader - was injured by a trap. He's calling us out on the lie

19.text: Come through that door, and you're getting a knife in the guts.
19.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. he's threatening the player, who just tried to convince him his boss - a bandit leader - was harmed by a trap. He's bluffing a little bit and is more worried than he's letting on
